title: ID font stamped on ceramics?
content:
Can anyone tell from such a small sample which font this is? I assume it was stamped into clay before going into the kiln. Is it just a muddy version of Caslon Old Face or one of the typewriter fonts? There are so many, I can't find a match.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016042023im_/http:/typophile.com/files/name-this-font_4318.jpg)
author: • ceramic

comments.content:
It's too hard to classify (for me).

Just to give an information:

In Germany and, I guess, all over the world, some artists use lead letters for their ceramic artwork. Just in Germany I got around half a dozend of them as customers.

The process those letters came through make it near impossible to trace the original typeface (unless maybe there’s some ceramist around here).  
For a similar look, your best bet is a distressed typewriter font.
